content: would you like to get into knitting but not sure where to start our super simple handwarmers are a great first project or do you just have cold hands and need a quick and easy fix then these handwarmers are just what you need the pattern is designed as a great my-first-knitting-project and suitable for beginners who have just learned to cast on knit purl and bind off and if not youtube is your new best friend working through a few simple stitch types all you need to do is knit a rectangle then sew it on up leaving a hole for the thumb make them for yourself your family & your friends and make them in one colour or as many as you like **sizes ** child adult **to fit hand ** approximately 14 18 cm measured across knuckles **yarn ** any 8ply / dk weight yarn we used woolly 8ply 104m/50g and you can use as many or as few colours as you like **quantity ** 45g total in 1 or more colours **needle ** 4mm needles **gauge ** 22sts x 30rows to 10cm in stocking stitch gauge is not too crucial for these **materials ** yarn needle for sewing up
